title: Unexpected drag and drop function
content:
Hello folks,

Have been trying to sort this problem for last couple of weeks with some limited success, first up I would say it may not be a Thunderbird issue but need to eliminate this along the way.

Problem relates to simple drag and drop functionality within Windows Explorer, selecting a file from right hand pane then left clicking before dragging to new folder location would cause unpredictable results, typically grabbing a whole tree of other folders and moving those too, the exact same problem applied to Thunderbird when moving emails either individually or as a group.

Desktop PC running Win 10 Pro, it does have a fancy graphics card with competing drivers, uninstalled everything and reinstalled with a clean install - this resolved the problem (so far) with Windows Explorer but puzzlingly has made no difference to Thunderbird, options tried so far include:

Using a different mouse Selecting 'click lock' from mouse controls - this works but it does feel a bit awkward Using another email client Outlook for desktop, doesn't seem as pronounced but still a bit awkward. Reverting back to Windows basic default graphics driver, all works as should but looks terrible

Has anyone come across this behaviour before?

Thanks
creator: JustOne

title: Move attachments pane back to the top right corner
content: Is there any way to make it so the attachments pane (when composing a message) is moved back to the top right corner of the email instead of being at the bottom? I'll attach a screenshot. I asked this question in 2021 after updating to Thunderbird 91.1.2 and the answer I got was to use an add-on called MoreLayouts, which had been working great the last few years but after the latest update (115.7.0) it says it's no longer supported. The only other solution I've been able to find is to use BetterBird but I'd much rather stick with TB if there's a way to do it. Thanks for your help
creator: manmachine78

title: Margins get wider and print column narrower for included messages in threads when printing
content: Thunderbird 115.6.0 on Linux. I'm trying to print a long email thread which includes many "replied" messages. The most recent message in the thread prints fine. As each successive message prints the margins get wider and the column of text gets smaller. At about page 22 I'm down to two or three words per line. Aside from making the text unreadable this phenomenon greatly increases the number of pages to print as fewer and fewer word get printed per page. By page 31 I'm down to one letter per line, withal resulting in 219 pages of mostly unreadable "lines" of single letters. Is there a setting to cancel this continuous indenting per message?
creator: MarkFoley

title: Cannot open Thunderbird
content: On 2023 December 29 Friday, as part of a general upgrade of my desktop computer, Thunderbird was upgraded to version 115-5-5.0-1~deb12u1amd54.deb. Since then however whenever I try to open Thun­derbird I always receive the following message: Thunderbird is already running, but is not responding. To use Thunderbird, you must first close the existing Thunderbird process, restart your device, or use a different profile. Furthermore, on the label of the desktop I use for Thunderbird label lists two windows open on it which are quoted in the box below. Password required Mozilla Thunderbird - Close Thunderbird In spite of the foregoing on the screen there is no window to enter a password nor Thunderbird to be closed. As for the one window that does appear, the first box above, I find its first assertion inordinately obfuscating under the circumstances. Thunderbird not only had not been installed but was obviously but also was incapable of responding to anything. I consequently doubt strongly that the text in the top box has anything to do the the problem I am having with the inability of Thunderbird to open. However, every time I try to open Thunderbird these three lock files are created: .parent lock cookies.sqlite-wal Telemetry.FailedProfileLocks.txt The first two I delete before every attempt to open Thunderbird. The third I leave alone, not under­standing what it means or what purpose it serves. It is updated every time I try. I also tried without success to open Thunderbird in safe mode. The location and name of thunderbird in my laptop is directory ~/mozilla/thunderbird/9vgk89rr.default. The profiles.ini file is located in directory ~/.thunderbird and reads as follows: [InstallFDC34C9F024745EB] Default=/home/ken/mozilla/thunderbird/9vgk89rr.default [Profile0] Name=ken IsRelative=0 Path=/home/ken/mozilla/thunderbird/9vgk89rr.default Default=1 [General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2 This current arrangement dates from 2021, but 9vgk89rr.default directory for Thunderbird dates from about 2006. It contains three of my most used email addresses, and all sorts of essential and valuable information. I need badly to have access to my Thunderbird as soon as possible and would appreciate greatly receiving information as to how to do so. Regards, Ken Heard
creator: cwkheard

title: THUNDERBIRD INBOX DOES NOT DISPLAY SENDERS NAME FROM CONTACTS
content: I have been using Thundebird some years now and I have created my contact list . Until recently everything worder perfect and one day all of a sudden thunderbird decided to ingore my contact list and display all the senders either by they mail or by the name they have chosen. I have tried some actions in order to correct it and I end up having the same mail up to 10 times in my contacts and still on the inbox the sender was still displayed differently . It seems like thunderbird is ignoring my contact list and keeps adding the contacts over and over .Also for an unknown to me reason some contacts that are allready added connot be processed through the inbox and the only option I have is to add them in contacts .So I think the program lost connection to my contact list some how.

title: Thunderbird not loading message content
content: Since Thunderbird updated to 115.7.0 yesterday, I can see message headers for new emails, but not the message content. Messages received before the update appear normally. Not getting any error messages. What do I need to do to get it to actually load the message?

title: Conversation View should only display messages belonging to same Mail Account
content:
Hi. When you right click a message and choose "Open Message in Conversation" the Conversation View shows messages belonging to all Mail Accounts configured in Thunderbird if copies were forwarded to those mailboxes.

I think it's natural to filter them out by default. Is there a feature or a plugin that does this?

title: La conexión al servidor imap.gmail.com ha superado el tiempo de espera máximo.
content: Hola, Una de las cuentas de correo en Thunderbird la tengo a punto de llenarse, deseo mover los correos de esa cuenta a otra cuenta que tengo de gmail, y en esa cuenta de gmail me sale el mensaje de "La conexión al servidor imap.gmail.com ha superado el tiempo de espera máximo.". He probado moviendo hasta sólo 1 correo y no me deja. Antes podía seleccionar los correos de un año y moverlos a la cuenta gmail y ahora me es imposible, qué puedo hacer?. Gracias por su ayuda.
creator: claudia-nunez
